name: VIM
description: This package introduces new tools for the visualization of missing and/or imputed values, which can be used for exploring the data and the structure of the missing and/or imputed values. Depending on this structure of the missing values, the corresponding methods may help to identify the mechanism generating the missings and allows to explore the data including missing values. In addition, the quality of imputation can be visually explored using various univariate, bivariate, multiple and multivariate plot methods.

name: icd

contribution_justification: Non-trivial contribution file in repository: <https://github.com/jackwasey/icd/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md>.
contribution_requirements_justification: "Contributions should follow the coding standard seen elsewhere in the package, which is defined by both the [general recommendations](http://adv-r.had.co.nz/Style.html) of Hadley Wickham, and the `.lintr` file in the project root directory. I'd prefer that new dependencies aren't included unless absolutely necessary."

enhancement_responses_justification: Most enhancement requests are my own, and others are generally out of scope (and thus closed issues), or are major long-term projects which require outside contributions to proceed.

test_invocation_justification: The standard R package checking and testing infrastructure.

delivery_mitm_justification: via standard CRAN distribution via HTTPS
dynamic_analysis_justification: The code does not run continuously: it gives a result and stops running.
dynamic_analysis_unsafe_justification: UBSAN and memory access are done in docker containers as part of checking process

name: harbor
description: Harbor is an an open source trusted cloud native registry project that stores, signs, and scans content.
contribution_justification: https://github.com/goharbor/harbor/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
license_location_justification: https://github.com/goharbor/harbor/blob/master/LICENSE
floss_license_justification: The Apache-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
floss_license_osi_justification: The Apache-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
documentation_basics_justification: https://github.com/goharbor/harbor/blob/master/docs/README.md
repo_public_justification: Repository on GitHub, which provides public git repositories with URLs.
repo_track_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git can track the changes, who made them, and when they were made.
repo_distributed_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git is distributed.
version_tags_justification: Harbor versions are expressed as **x.y.z**, where **x** is the major version, **y** is the minor version, and **z** is the patch version, following [Semantic Versioning terminology](https://semver.org/).  Please see https://github.com/goharbor/harbor/releases
release_notes_justification:
human readable release notes are attached to the source codes on the release page

https://github.com/goharbor/harbor/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md
release_notes_vulns_justification: The project identifies publicly known vulnerabilities in release notes for officially filed CVEs which come with a CVSS score.  Please see this for detailed process: https://github.com/goharbor/harbor/blob/master/SECURITY.md
report_responses_justification: The project's maintainers hold bi-weekly meetings to review and respond to all incoming enhancement requests from the community
enhancement_responses_justification: all issues here (https://github.com/goharbor/harbor/issues) are tracked and triaged in bi-weekly meetings with 2-4weeks turnaround time.
vulnerability_report_private_justificati: reported vulnerabilities are reported to cncf-harbor-security@lists.cncf.io and kept private during embargo period, please see details here: https://github.com/goharbor/harbor/blob/master/SECURITY.md
vulnerability_report_response_justificat: Initial response to vulnerability by Harbor security team is 3 business days and report date to public disclosure date to be on the order of 14 business days. please see details here: https://github.com/goharbor/harbor/blob/master/SECURITY.md
build_justification:
The project uses Travis CI for build and detailed build process here:
https://github.com/goharbor/harbor/blob/master/docs/compile_guide.md

Non-trivial build file can be also be found in repository: <https://github.com/goharbor/harbor/blob/master/Makefile>.
build_common_tools_justification:
The project uses Travis CI for build and detailed build process here:
https://github.com/goharbor/harbor/blob/master/docs/compile_guide.md

Non-trivial build file can be also be found in repository: <https://github.com/goharbor/harbor/blob/master/Makefile>.
build_floss_tools_justification: The project is buildable using only FLOSS tools
test_justification:
The project uses Travis CI for all internal feature development as well as generate builds off PRs in the github repo.  
https://travis-ci.org/goharbor/harbor
test_invocation_justification: Project uses 'go test' to trigger UT tests
test_most_justification: Travis CI uses coveralls to provide coverage
test_policy_justification:
All new features must go through the Harbor's Travids CI pipeline and pass human review as well as automated testing and coveralls requirements.

please also see: 
https://github.com/goharbor/harbor/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#automated-testing
tests_are_added_justification: The project runs automatic Travis CI pipelines against pull requests which must pass before being merged.  PRs also have to go through unit testing for backend services and UI tests.
tests_documented_added_justification: This is outlined in the contribution process (https://github.com/goharbor/harbor/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md)
warnings_justification: The project uses golint and govet for enable/disable compiler warnings which directly impacts CI pass/fail, managing coding style and correctness
warnings_fixed_justification: The project uses golint and govet for managing compiler warnings, coding style, and correctness
warnings_strict_justification: The project can enable gating any pull request by certain warnings, but likely don't.
know_secure_design_justification: The core developers of Harbor are familiar with designing secure software and Harbor has undergone a 3rd party penetration test by cure53
know_common_errors_justification: The core developers of Harbor are familiar with designing secure software and Harbor has undergone a 3rd party penetration test by cure53
crypto_published_justification: The project uses only cryptographic protocols and algorithms that are publicly published and reviewed by experts.
crypto_call_justification: The project does not reimplement its own cryptographic functions.
crypto_keylength_justification: The project's instances of symmetric encryption all use key lengths of 128 bit.
crypto_working_justification: The project does not depend on broken cryptographic algorithms.
crypto_pfs_justification: The project implements perfect forward secrecy for key agreement protocols so a session key derived from a set of long-term keys cannot be compromised if one of the long-term keys is compromised in the future.
crypto_password_storage_justification: The project does not store passwords for authentication of external users against Harbor
crypto_random_justification:
"The project uses cryptogrpahically secure random number generators (golang and python official rand library)
tracking:https://github.com/goharbor/harbor/issues/9423"
delivery_unsigned_justification: The default mode of https ensures no cryptographic hash of any kind is retrieved over http.  This is detailed in the installation guide (https://github.com/goharbor/harbor/blob/master/docs/installation_guide.md)
vulnerabilities_fixed_60_days_justificat: There are currently no known vulnerabilities of high criticallity in the project that have not been already patched.  Vulnerabilities reporting and disclosure process is here: https://github.com/goharbor/harbor/blob/master/SECURITY.md
vulnerabilities_critical_fixed_justifica: There are currently no known vulnerabilities of high criticallity in the project that have not been already patched.  Vulnerabilities reporting and disclosure process is here: https://github.com/goharbor/harbor/blob/master/SECURITY.md
static_analysis_justification: The project uses golint and govet in our Travis CI to perform static code analysis on all releases, not just major production releases
static_analysis_common_vulnerabilities_j: The project uses golint / go vet to perform static analysis on all commits through its Travis CI pipeline.  Project also uses gosec ( https://github.com/securego/gosec) for secure static analysis.
static_analysis_fixed_justification: The project runs static analysis continuously and issues are triaged and fixed right away on the nightly build before merged to master
static_analysis_often_justification: all pull requests and commits are run with golint.
dynamic_analysis_justification: The project uses golint, go race, and go vet to make sure code is readable, safe, and correct.  All unit tests will be triggerd via go test against the pull request.  Special attention is paid to the Travis CI result and the coverage report
dynamic_analysis_unsafe_justification: The project does not produce any software written in a memory-unsafe language
dynamic_analysis_enable_assertions_justi: This does not apply to golang
dynamic_analysis_fixed_justification: All medium and high severity vulnerabilities discovered through dynamic code analysis internally are triaged and fixed immediately before release
crypto_weaknesses_justification: The project's default security mechanisms do not depend on weak algorithms or modes with serious weaknesses such as SHA-1
test_continuous_integration_justificatio:
The project implements continuous integration through the use of Travis CI, which runs on every single commit to DEV and Master
https://travis-ci.org/goharbor/harbor
discussion_justification: GitHub supports discussions on issues and pull requests.
no_leaked_credentials_justification: The project does not keep any private credentials in any public repositories
english_justification:
Github supports bug reporting and commenting on pull requests as detailed here:
https://github.com/goharbor/harbor/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#reporting-issues
hardening_justification: Project performs static and dynamic code analysis through Travis CI.  Every release also pays attention to latest list of CVEs that may impact Harbor components as well as supported distros and OS which if pertinent will be patched on the next patch (minor) release.
crypto_used_network_justification:
The projects supports TLS in all of its network transmissions, some of which is detailed in the installation and deployment guide here: https://github.com/goharbor/harbor/blob/master/docs/installation_guide.md

In addtion, HTTPS and certificates configuration is detailed in separate document here: https://github.com/goharbor/harbor/blob/master/docs/configure_https.md
crypto_tls12_justification: The project is written in Go which has native support for TLS version 1.2 and beyond
crypto_certificate_verification_justific: The project performs TLS certificate verification by default
crypto_verification_private_justificatio: The project performs TLS certificate verification by default
hardened_site_justification: // X-Content-Type-Options was not set to "nosniff".
installation_common_justification: This is detailed in the installation_guide.md (https://github.com/goharbor/harbor/blob/master/docs/installation_guide.md)
implementation_languages: Go, TypeScript, RobotFramework, Python, Shell, Smarty, Makefile, Dockerfile, PLpgSQL, JavaScript, Mako
dco_justification: All PRs on github undergo DCO that shows 'signed-off' by requester.  This check must pass before PR can even reach merge request.  Please see (https://github.com/goharbor/harbor/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md)
roles_responsibilities_justification: The GOVERNANCE.md (https://github.com/goharbor/community/blob/master/GOVERNANCE.md) clearly define the maintainer responsibilities while the MAINTAINERS.md (https://github.com/goharbor/community/blob/master/MAINTAINERS.md) lists all maintainers as well as core maintainers of Harbor
access_continuity_justification: Harbor has more than 20 active maintainers including 5 maintainers at any given time.  Core maintainers have admin rights to the Git repository and can create and track issues, merge PRs, and release new patches and versions of the software.  Please see (https://github.com/goharbor/community/blob/master/MAINTAINERS.md)
bus_factor_justification: The project achieves a 'bus factor' of 2 or more, there are currently (and has been for some time) way more than 2 active maintainers who contribute and release code.  Please see https://github.com/goharbor/community/blob/master/MAINTAINERS.md
documentation_roadmap_justification: ROADMAP.md (https://github.com/goharbor/community/blob/master/MAINTAINERS.md) is used to track product roadmap
documentation_architecture_justification: https://github.com/goharbor/harbor/wiki/Architecture-Overview-of-Harbor details core software components as well key client interactions with them
documentation_quick_start_justification: The installation and user guide (https://github.com/goharbor/harbor/wiki/Architecture-Overview-of-Harbor) contains detailed steps on installing and deploying Harbor for common on-premise use cases.
documentation_current_justification: All docs are curated and updated here: https://github.com/goharbor/harbor/tree/master/docs
documentation_achievements_justification: Harbor github repo will link all badges (including CII) achieved within 48 hours of recognition.  Please see (https://github.com/goharbor/harbor)
accessibility_best_practices_justificati: does not currently have best practices for persons with disabilities
internationalization_justification: The project maintains both English (primary) and Chinese (secondary) for the client application and has done so since its inception.  Logs and documentation are in English only based on demand.
sites_password_security_justification: Project is maintained entirely through GitHub which meets this criteria
maintenance_or_update_justification: Every Harbor release is tested for upgrades from older releases and the uprade process is detailed in the upgradetest.md (https://github.com/goharbor/harbor/blob/master/docs/upgradetest.md)
vulnerability_report_credit_justificatio: Vulnerability information including detailed reporter information are all disclosed on the CVE created through on the CVSS( https://www.first.org/cvss/specification-document) Please see security process: https://github.com/goharbor/harbor/blob/master/SECURITY.md
vulnerability_response_process_justifica: vulnerability reporting, response, and disclosure are all carefully documented here: https://github.com/goharbor/harbor/blob/master/SECURITY.md
coding_standards_justification: The project uses golint to enforce coding styles.  Please see (https://github.com/goharbor/harbor/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#develop-build-and-test)
coding_standards_enforced_justification: The project uses golint to enforce coding styles
build_preserve_debug_justification: Harbor is written in Go and standard build can be configured to preserve all debugging information with relevant flags.
build_non_recursive_justification: The project does not recursively build subdirectories and there are no cross-dependencies in the subdirectories.  Go's compiler ensure's the dependency of packages are handled correctly.
build_repeatable_justification: This requirement has been satisfied by https://github.com/goharbor/harbor/pull/9828
installation_standard_variables_justific: There is no standard convention applicable since project is packaged and delievered in docker container format as opposed to on a standard POSIX system.  Users are advised to follow Docker recommended practice in this regard.
installation_development_quick_justifica: This is detailed in the installation_guide.md (https://github.com/goharbor/harbor/blob/master/docs/installation_guide.md)
external_dependencies_justification: The project lists all its external dependencies in the installation guide (https://github.com/goharbor/harbor/blob/master/docs/installation_guide.md)
dependency_monitoring_justification: We carefully scan for vulnerabilities of ALL computer-processeable dependencies in our software using AppCheck (https://appcheck-ng.com) on a weekly basis.  Upon discovery of vulnerabilities, we triage and disclose them using Harbor's security reporting and disclosure process (SECURITY.md)
updateable_reused_components_justificati: The project uses Go modules for dependency versioning and dependency management.
interfaces_current_justification: The project avoids using deprecated or obsolete functions
automated_integration_testing_justificat: Travis CI is configured to run automated tests for all incoming change requests on all repos and builds.  Each test must pass before change request is pushed through to merge request.
regression_tests_added50_justification: Regression tests are run for at least 50% of all bugs fixed within the last six months
test_statement_coverage80_justification: The project uses Travis CI and coveralls
test_policy_mandated_justification: Automated testing is detailed in the CONTRIBUTION.md (https://github.com/goharbor/harbor/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#automated-testing)
implement_secure_design_justification: The project uses the strongest secure design principles where applicable including prolific use of HTTP/S, TLS, Certificates, secrets
input_validation_justification:
The project results checks all inputs from potentially untrusted sources (docker login, web console login, cve whitelist,
docker push etc) to ensure they are valid
crypto_algorithm_agility_justification: The project supports multiple cryptophic algorithms throughout including SHA-256.
crypto_credential_agility_justification: The project supports secure cold storage of private cryptographic keys and dynamic tokens.
signed_releases_justification: all releases published on GitHub come with signature
version_tags_signed_justification: all releases published on GitHub come with signature
